result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrell D Hagamon III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:32 PM Defendant Darrell D Hagamon III in court.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Darrell D Hagamon III.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim present in court. State motions to amend Count 2 to reflect 947.01 without the repeater enhancer; granted by Court.  Count 1 and 2: Plea of guilty.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.  Court imposes 90 days on each county in county jail to run concurrently - STAYED.  18 months probation.  Conditions of probation: Continue AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent, Obtain and maintain gainful employment, Participate in anger management, Any other conditions deemed appropriate by agents, Costs of  $443 on each count plus the $100 DV surcharge on Count 1.  9 days credit

2:25 PM Defendant Darrell D Hagamon III appeared by zoom phone.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Darrell D Hagamon III.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. State has extended an offer.  Defense wishes to proceed to PLEAS.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Nagel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nagel received complaint and waives reading and enters not guilty pleas. Court accepts waiver and enters plea. Court sets pre trial for May 31st at 10:45 am.

No abusive contact with K.H. dob 1996 no contact with C.A.S. dob 1978.   Maintain absolute sobriety.

Court will amend bond to no abusive contact with K.H. dob 1996 no contact with C.A.S. dob 1978.   Maintain absolute sobriety.

Maintain absolute sobriety no contact with K.H. dob 1996 and no contact with C.A.S dob 1978.
